Full Job Description
Overview:
The Project Manager is responsible for management of design phase of assigned Real Estate Projects, including conceptual design development, detailed design development, permitting and other preconstruction/design-related tasks. Ensures brand and prototypical design standards are met while adhering to prescribed schedules and budgets.

Flexible Hybrid Schedule!
Essential Functions:
Manage the end-to-end process of design development and permitting for assigned Real Estate Projects
Consolidate and review of Conceptual Design Documents and Lease Exhibits for conformance to prototype standards and work with third-party architect and Sr. Project Manager, Architecture to facilitate approvals
Manage the development of site-specific Final Design Documents and Specifications (all disciplines) through third-party partners, including review of the same for conformance with Prototype Standards and Specifications
Manage timelines and Budgets for Design/Permitting Phase of assigned Projects
Correspond with project stakeholders (Architects/Engineers, Store Planning Team, Construction Managers and Departmental Leadership) as necessary to articulate design details, project status, risks and issues, and other matters as part of a team to deliver exceptional New Store Projects to our Customers
Assist Sr. Project Manager, Architecture with continuous improvement of Prototype Standards and functional processes and partnerships
#LI-MS1
#LI-Hybrid
SSS123
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Physical Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience
Minimum of 3 years of project management experience:
Within the real estate organization of a retailer or similar organization, or
Within a professional design/architecture firm, with demonstrated experience on retail or similar projects
Able to manage multiple priorities to adhere to tight timelines in a fast-paced environment
Ability to effectively manage third-party professional partner teams and collaborate with internal stakeholder teams to achieve desired results
Benefits:
In addition to a rewarding career, Sprouts offers a comprehensive program to help support you and your family. These programs include:
Competitive pay
Sick time plan that you can use to support you or your immediate families health
Vacation accrual plan
Opportunities for career growth
15% discount for you and one other family member in your household on all purchases made at Sprouts
Flexible schedules
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
401(K) Retirement savings plan with a generous company match
Company paid life insurance
Contests and appreciation events throughout the year full of prizes, food and fun!
Eligibility requirements may apply for the following benefits:
Bonus based on company and/or individual performance
Affordable benefit coverage, including medical, dental and vision
Health Savings Account with company match
Pre-tax Flexible Spending Accounts for healthcare and dependent care
Company paid short-term disability coverage
Paid parental leave for both mothers and fathers
Paid holidays
Why Sprouts:
Grow with us!
If you have a passion for inspiring people and a flair for fresh food, consider applying for a job at Sprouts! With a focus on customer service, our neighborhood grocery stores offer high-quality, farm fresh produce, natural meats, plenty of scoop-your-own bulk goods and much more in a fun, friendly, old-fashioned farmer’s market setting. Come grow your career in healthy living with a fast-paced, rapidly growing company and teams that pride themselves on empowering others along their journey.

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by people assigned to this work. This is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and requirements. Sprouts’ management reserves the right to amend and change duties, responsibilities, and requirements to meet business and organizational needs as necessary.

California Residents: We collect information in accordance with California law, please see here for more information.

DIRECT HIRE | ARCHITECT | Phoenix, AZ or Orlando, FL |

Our client is seeking a Registered Architect to join their team. The successful candidate will be responsible for conducting analyses to support the design of prefabricated structures. This will involve using techniques and software to evaluate the strength and stability of these structures, as well as ensuring that they meet all relevant codes and regulations.

KEY SKILLS: registered Architect, PE/SE, Energy Analysis, Design/Review, Pre-Engineered Structures, Prefabricated Buildings and Structures, Manufacturer


Anticipate $110K-$140K, dependent on experience
Full suite of benefits, PTO, Bonuses
Ideal locations are Phoenix, AZ and Leesburg, FL (may consider other location)
Registered Architect; Arizona, California, and/or Florida are preferred
Seeking:

Bachelor of Science, Registered Architect
Previous experience with wood, steel, or hybrid construction preferred (integrated steel chassis)
Experience with Building Construction Design, Life safety egress plans and calculations
Previous Military experience a plus (security clearance, SCIF)
Software experience; Excel, CAD (for mark-ups), Revit, Architectural Desktop, Enercalc, ComCheck
Ability to communicate and work with teams in Engineering, Sales, Estimating, Production, etc.
Goal is to have the ability to design, review, and stamped by architect of record

Full Job Description

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.



Your Impact:

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.
We are looking for a Process Architect that would work remotely or hybrid for our Life Sciences Team. The Process Architect will be responsible for the following: plans, programs, designs, authors, coordinates, and supervises construction of life sciences building projects for clients according to their desires, needs, and financial resources. Responsible for developing, maintaining and revising project budgets and schedules.
Works closely with architectural design and technical leadership as well as engineering discipline project leads to design, develop, document, observe and administer the construction of complex program driven facilities
Expert understanding of building materials and systems, methods of construction and the integration of building services, structure, building core and envelope elements
Responsible for project technical quality and timely delivery of architecture deliverables
Meets with clients, client representatives, constructors to discuss technical aspects of project design, delivery, and construction
Understands and conversant in technical issues relating to sustainability and energy conservation
Provides general technical expertise for the department, mentors architecture staff, participates in QC peer review of projects other than their own
May assist in maintaining and developing department master specifications
Here’s What You’ll Need:

8+ years of experience as an Architect on major projects
BA/BS or BArch
Registered Architect in the U.S. preferred
Exceptional knowledge in the design of FDA-regulated pharmaceutical and bio-tech manufacturing and laboratory facilities is preferred
Excellent presentation skills in Google Sketch-Up and/or Lumien
Ideally, you will have:
Some knowledge of Revit preferred
Membership in ISPE is preferred
Please note: This position can be remote within the US
#LifeSciences, #Bio/Pharma, #EPCMV

At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private sector.

Requisition ID: 264295

Relocation Authorized: International - Family
Telework Type: Part-Time Telework
Work Location: Phoenix, AZ

Company Overview

Bechtel helps clients deliver projects of purpose that create a lasting positive legacy globally. These projects create jobs and grow economies; improve the resiliency of the world's infrastructure; connect communities to resources and opportunities; get us closer to net zero; tackle critical environmental challenges to protect people and the planet; and accelerate progress to make the world a cleaner, greener, safer place. To achieve these goals, individuals from Bechtel bring their experience and expertise to the role while working within the client’s organization as part of an integrated team. We are committed to supporting the client’s goals while promoting our values of fairness, diversity, inclusion, trust and collaboration guided by our Vision, Values and Covenants.


Position Summary

The Semiconductor Architect is a SME who is self-motivated, high performing expert with a proven track record in the design and construction of semiconductor (and other advanced technology manufacturing) facilities. The role is critical to the business growth and successful delivery of projects for Manufacturing and Technology (M&T) clients. This position has responsibility to identify, develop and incorporate industry leading processes/tools, and to provide training and development of our design and construction professionals to ensure the quality delivery of semiconductor fabs and other technology manufacturing facilities. This SME role provides the highest level of expertise and oversite for M&T projects.


Position Responsibilities:

The key areas of responsibility comprise of technical excellence, driving innovation, consistency, design guides and standards, work processes/tools, and internal/external relationships.

Subject matter expert for Semiconductor Facilities: Fabs, technical support buildings, site layouts, codes and overall multi-discipline consideration and integration
Participates and actively engages in relevant professional organizations and conferences.
Provides expertise to project teams from FEED and all phases of project delivery through to startup and turnover.
Works with client system owners and all team stakeholders to ensure that facilities are meeting client requirements and performance expectations.
Provides team mentorship of design and construction activities, covering the full delivery cycle.
Participates, as required, in design and construction reviews, management reviews and proposals.
Participates or leads in the assessment of technical issues and contributes experience and expertise in the solution of difficult problems.
Participates, when requested, in major project reviews
Assists with ensuring project quality and off-project technical reviews
Assists with developing proposals and schedules
Provides review, approval, and deployment of best practices/lessons learned
Deploys to projects to assist with on-project technical challenges
Performs cold-eye technical audits on key design and construction areas.


Qualifications and Skills:

Basic Qualifications

Licensed Architect (RA) in the United States or non-US equivalent.
Minimum 15 years of experience directly relating to and including architectural design, development and construction of semiconductor facilities.
Substantial experience in EPC delivery of semiconductor facilities, with multiple years in a leadership role.
Extensive experience with major regulations and industry codes and standards affecting standard design, specification, and quality.
Knowledgeable in critical elements that inform and drive the design of typical semiconductor (and other M&T) facilities.
Extensive experience and knowledge of technical trends and their current and future impacts to these facilities from a supplier standpoint and the end-user facility and operational standpoint.


Preferred Qualifications:

A bachelors or higher degree in Architecture from an accredited university or equivalent.
NCARB certified
Excellent communication and people development skills.
Extensive relevant experience and adaptability to support technical facilities required in other M&T sectors (Data Centers, Electric Vehicle verticals).

Shaping tomorrow together

Bechtel is one of the most respected global engineering, construction, and project management companies. Together with our customers, we deliver landmark projects that foster long-term progress and economic growth. Since 1898, we’ve completed more than 25,000 extraordinary projects across 160 countries on all seven continents. We operate through four global businesses: Infrastructure; Nuclear, Security & Environmental; Energy; and Mining & Metals. Our company and our culture are built on more than a century of leadership and a relentless adherence to our values, the core of which are safety, quality, ethics, and integrity. These values are what we believe, what we expect, what we deliver, and what we live.
www.bechtel.com

Bechtel is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, citizenship status (except as authorized by law), protected veteran status, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

In accordance with Bechtel's duty to provide and maintain a safe workplace for our employees and to safeguard the health of our families, customers, and visitors, we have adopted mandatory COVID-19 safety protocols for each work location, which may include a vaccination or testing requirement. Please speak with your Bechtel recruiter to determine which protocols apply to the work location for the job you are seeking.

Full Job Description

If you are a self-motivated professional who is looking to take on more responsibility in leading Architecture projects related to educational, municipal, and industrial facilities, while seeking an employer that will focus on your specific career goals delivering high-quality professional services, then we encourage you to strongly consider this position. With top tier benefits, and the understanding of a real work life balance, Wilson & Company provides a career-nurturing work environment.




Wilson & Company is seeking an experienced Licensed Architect to serve as a Architectural Project Manager & Architect in our Phoenix, AZ office. This professional will be responsible for delivering quality projects to our valued clients while building relationships that will help to grow our practice. Depending on the needs of the project, this position will perform both lead and supporting roles on various projects, tasks, and business development activities in Arizona and possibly in other states.




Essential Job Functions:

Work collaboratively with and mentor junior staff in a positive and professional manner.
Work cooperatively with the architecture group in New Mexico, Texas and other Wilson & Company Divisions throughout the 15 offices.
Effectively foster relationships with team members and clients, as well as industry stakeholders and regulators.
High degree of interpersonal and effective communication skills.



Responsibilities and Duties:

Project Manager | Project Architect – responsible for the delivery of project scope elements within budget and schedule without the sacrifice of quality.
Develop project management plans to include clear definition of scope, schedule and fee leading to the successful execution of projects for our clients.
Provide direction and oversight to programming, design, preparation of construction documents, graphical illustrations, and other key tasks essential to serving our clients architectural needs.
Build the Practice - Business Development throughout the state of Arizona, Texas, New Mexico and potentially other states.


Required Skills

High level of independence, confidence, and strong work ethic with a passion for achievement and success.
Effective and clear writing and verbal communication skill.
Candidates must be proficient in all phases of design, construction documents and construction administration.


Required Experience

Bachelor of Science degree in Architecture in an NAAB-accredited college or university.
A Master’s degree in Architecture is a plus.
A minimum of 15 years of relevant work experience. (20 years preferred.)
Proof of being a licensed Architect in Arizona for at least 15 years.
Experience with Microsoft Office, Autodesk AutoCAD, and Revit platforms.



Please note that Wilson & Company is not currently sponsoring applicants for work visas.




Annual Salary Range: $90,000 - $125,000




About Us:

Wilson & Company has a rich history in planning and design, and the right candidate will become part of our bright future. We provide multidisciplinary engineering, architecture, surveying, mapping, environmental, and planning services, and employ staff throughout 15 offices in 9 states. The firm was founded in 1932 and provides services to a diverse client base including railroads; municipal, state, and federal agencies; energy, industrial, and commercial companies; and private developers.




The cornerstone of our success is Higher Relationships, standards in Discipline, Intensity, Collaboration, Shared Ownership, and Solutions. Discipline is doing it right, with attention to details without exception. Intensity is doing what it takes to meet and exceed expectations. Collaboration is working together and bringing out the best in each other. Shared Ownership means we adopt the goals of others as our own. Finally, Solutions are achieved in a win-win environment. We value this commitment to Higher Relationships with our employees, clients, and the communities where we live and work. And for you, our culture intends to help you achieve personal and professional success. Come grow with us!




Wilson & Company provides a comprehensive benefits package that encourages employee health and well-being. We have several options to choose from for health insurance, life insurance, disability insurance, paid time off, and retirement savings plan benefits. We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment background checks.




Wilson & Company is a federal contractor and subject to various health and safety regulations enforced by federal, state, and local agencies, as well as health and safety requirements of our clients. Wilson & Company is committed to complying with all regulations and requirements, which could include, but are not limited to, vaccination requirements, testing requirements, masking requirements, and personal protective equipment requirements. All regulations and requirements are subject to change, which could impact Wilson & Company policy and requirements for employees.

Full Job Description

Our People & Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the "why" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.

Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.



Your Impact:


At Jacobs, advanced facilities simplify our everyday lives, enabling technology to connect us. We push the limits of what’s possible to make the world smarter, more connected and more sustainable.




As a Senior Architect, you will be an integral member of a highly creative, in-house multi-disciplinary team dedicated to innovative problem-solving and design excellence. You will support our highly collaborative architectural design studio in a fully integrated A&E practice to meet our clients ever-changing needs and have a hand in transforming tomorrow. In this role, you will be responsible for the design and construction of facilities and structures for our clients requiring advanced planning and building techniques. Position is located in Phoenix, AZ (relocation assistance may be available).




Collaborating in our fast-paced environment with other members of our team, you will work across all phases of design, performing conceptual and detailed design tasks. You will oversee design and construction activities, studies, and various analyses, leading design coordination across architecture and engineering disciplines. Working with our team’s architects and designers, you will help develop design solutions and lead the group to communicate design requirements in project drawings and models. As part of the Electronics architecture group, you will also have an opportunity to provide technical guidance and supervision to junior team members, help your team discover what drives them, nurture their purpose, and guide them forward. If you’re up for the challenge, we’ve been looking for someone just like you. Join our team and help us lay the foundation for human progress.




Bring your creativity, ambitious spirit and desire to bring value to your team, and we’ll help you grow, pursue and fulfill what drives you – so we can deliver extraordinary solutions for a better tomorrow, together.




Here’s What You’ll Need:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Architecture from accredited Architectural program
Professional Architecture license in AZ
At least 10 years of experience
Knowledge of principles and practices of building material technology and detailing
Working knowledge building codes and specifications
Revit experience



Ideally, you’ll also have:

Advanced facilities building design experience, such as semiconductor, industrial, or manufacturing
Commitment to quality, exhibiting a high level of attention to detail and quality control
Ability to provide technical guidance and coaching to designers and less-experienced architects
Strong organizational skills
Leadership experience motivating and coordinating small to medium architecture teams
Ability to work in a timely, accurate, and cost-effective manner, and able to help others do the same
Awareness of sustainable and emerging technologies
Sketch up, Adobe Suite, and InDesign skills
LEED accreditation



#afelectronics #architecture

At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you'll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.

Jacobs health and welfare benefits are designed to invest in you, and in the things you care about. Your health. Your well-being. Your security. Your future. Typical benefits offered include, educational reimbursement, retirement benefits, employee stock purchase plan, health benefits, disability benefits, life and accident insurance, voluntary benefits, paid time off, paid holidays, and parental leave. Salary to be offered is geographic dependent and commensurate with experience relative to the position.

As an Architect and Design Representative, under direct supervision, this position represents skilled and/or experienced level sales professionals. The assumption is that this position has received company orientation and/or some limited specification/ color and sales training and has generated revenue and/or profit margin in its accounts and territories. This candidate will be responsible for learning sales techniques and reporting daily or weekly activity to an Area Manager as well as CRM input and follow-up. Generally, focuses on local market accounts and prospects and participates in key account sales teams. Frequently reports to an Area Manager. This regional position is a key specification driver in establishing, maintaining, and growing our architectural specification share for PPG Paints through our commercial paint products and color. This position is a system approach to nontraditional selling with strong relationship-building skills requiring on-site recommendations, guidance, and project meetings with owners, architects, interior designers, product specifiers, general contractors, and key corporate accounts.

Key Responsibilities

A day in the life: Build and develop relationships with firms/customers to strengthen the relationship with PPG. Once relationship is built, further presentations will be required to influence the project specification as Basis of Design, As/Or Equal and to ensure PPG is listed as an approved manufacturer for products and color.
The outward title of Architectural and Design Representative role addresses architect/specifier, interior designer, and general contractor needs to generate construction documents known as specifications and color schedules or also known as finish schedules, to paint new commercial buildings and monumental projects.
This role will address both product systems on the technical side and the color schedules on the design side and must possess the higher-level understanding of complexity and proficiency of both.
Project tracking and planning, communicating plans, allocating tasks, setting milestones, and effective time management and self-motivation skills are key.
This position will call on those firms and general contractors who influence specifications for commercial businesses, building/office space, retail, hotels, resorts, etc.
The role is expected to hold technical paint system conversations with specification writers and discuss color schemes with interior designers.
Role is expected to hold technical paint system conversations as well as preparation recommendations with specification writers and discuss color schemes with interior designers.
Must have excellent communication! Listening and public speaking skills, along with strong team interaction skills and a high disposition for collaboration with colleagues.


Qualifications

Minimum of 5 years of experience in specification and color design work with a consistent track record of success; prior sales experience is a must as this is a leadership role converting specification opportunities to revenue.
Interior Design Degree and/or equivalent experience to influence Architectural Specifications Communication skills must embody customer centric communication in person, virtual and verbal. Strong presentation skills and competency in front of various audiences is a must.
Knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, PowerPoint, Adobe Illustrator or Photoshop, and web-based applications (Construct Connect, BSD, AVITRU, BIM/REVIT) is a must.
The ability to engage with our company CRM system on all levels and involve every level of employees and customers. Excellent organizational and project management/tracking skills Preference is given to subject matter experts in AIA Master Format and CSI/CDC Three Part Format, IIDA or ASID.
Must understand the relationship between Owner/Architect-Designer/General Contractor/Painter. Must possess and maintain a valid Driver's License. Most of all must be self-motivated and a self-starter.




About us:
Here at PPG we make it happen, and we seek candidates of the highest integrity and professionalism who share our values, with the commitment and drive to strive today to do better than yesterday – everyday.
PPG: WE PROTECT AND BEAUTIFY THE WORLD™
Through leadership in innovation, sustainability and color, PPG helps customers in industrial, transportation, consumer products, and construction markets and aftermarkets to enhance more surfaces in more ways than does any other company. To learn more, visit www.ppg.com and follow @ PPG on Twitter.
The PPG Way
Every single day at PPG:
We partner with customers to create mutual value.
We are insightful, dedicated and proactive. We have intimate knowledge of the market and our customers. We focus on practical solutions that make a difference.
We are “One PPG” to the world.
We are better and stronger together. We leverage our scale to reach new markets and introduce innovative technologies as we differentiate and disrupt our markets.
We trust our people every day, in every way.
We enable and empower our people to make the right decisions. We are inclusive, transparent and respectful. Our feedback is clear and actionable.
We make it happen.

We run it like we own it.

About Larson Design Group

Larson Design Group (LDG) is an employee-owned (ESOP), Architectural, Engineering, and Surveying Firm. Since our founding in 1986, we’ve been teaming with clients nationwide to provide responsive, innovative solutions by offering an extraordinary depth and breadth of capabilities and embracing sustainable business practices. For more than 30 years, these principles have guided our work and laid the foundation for a robust growth that has elevated our aspirations even higher. From organizations both local and national in scope, we’re being recognized with awards and climbing the ranks of industry lists. We are expanding our footprint across the nation and looking to add more top talent to our team. We have fourteen office locations across Pennsylvania, New York, Ohio, Arizona, Oklahoma and Florida. We offer a flexible work environment, competitive benefits package, and continued professional development. Come join the excitement at LDG!

Impact and Opportunity:

This Architect position is required to have a Registered Architect (RA) license with NCARB certification and commensurate work experience. This position will coordinate overall design activities, have increased client interactions, and will be responsible for additional Quality Assurance and Quality Control duties to help ensure the final product meets the technical requirements and goals of the client.

Key Responsibilities:

Performs independent planning and design tasks, reviews work of others, prepares construction documents, and successfully delivers projects to completion.
Knowledge and experience with technically complex projects. Knowledge of codes and standards applicable to design of projects.
Maintains collaborative inter-departmental and cross functional working relationships with members of the project team.
Performs final QA/QC review of projects prior to delivery to client or release for bidding/ construction.
Assists project manager in development of technical proposals and labor hour estimates.
Works closely with clients and project teams to effectively describe and deliver the scope of work.

Requirements:

Education: Five (5) year Bachelor of Architecture degree or Six (6) year Master’s Degree from NAAB accredited school.
Experience: Five (5) years’ job-related practice.
Licensure/Certification: Registered Architect (RA) with NCARB certification required.

Preferred Qualifications:

Must possess the ability to work both independently and as part of a Project Team, possess strong leadership & interpersonal skills, and strong time management skills.
Must be able to interact professionally with clients, vendors, regulatory agencies, and other external sources in a professional manner.
Must be proficient in public speaking, time management, and delegation. Basic understanding of AutoCAD Civil 3D, and LDG Software Packages.
Intermediate to advanced level of knowledge of MS Office and Deltek Vision.

This position will be responsible for the delivery of Capital Improvement Projects, renewal, customer funded, and FMSG maintenance projects, assigned to the unit. Duties will include, but not be limited to initial meetings with customers, development of scopes of work, retention of consultants, review of construction documents, construction administration, submittal review, and project closeout. Additionally, responsible for project scheduling, establishing estimates of probable cost, reviewing pay applications, ensuring all project funding monies are spent within the proper time frames, ensuring compliance with procurement rules, requesting purchase orders, working in partnership with unit architects and designers, assisting in the advertisement of construction projects by the Procurement Office, and assisting in the selection of architects, engineers, and vendors. This position will also require the ability to utilize architectural AutoCad software to assist unit architects and designers to produce design drawings and architectural construction drawings for selected projects with the possession of basic building detailing and material understanding skills, and the ability to organize and apply Cad skills to existing FMSG Cad files. This position occasionally requires work outside of normal business hours and days, and requires occasional travel throughout the state of Arizona.

The State of Arizona strives for a work culture that affords employees flexibility, autonomy, and trust. Across our many agencies, boards, commissions, many State employees participate in the State’s Remote Work Program and are able to work remotely in their homes, in offices, and in hoteling spaces. All work, including remote work, should be performed within Arizona, unless an exception is properly authorized in advance.



Job Duties:

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Contract Administration of medium to large renovations, new constructions, and FMSG maintenance projects; scope of work, scheduling, budget control, estimating.

Assist unit architects and designers with AutoCad drafting and design drawing development.

Contract Administration of small projects.

Direct vendors and review vendor provided designs.

Execute business strategies implemented by ADOT leadership and identify continuous improvement opportunities.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities (KSAs):

Knowledge of

Vertical construction means and methods

Building system understanding (structural, mechanical and production engineering, information technology, civil, etc.)

Understanding of construction trades and their responsibilities

Understanding of construction materials, detailing, and finishes

Architectural drafting and 2D drawing development

Probable construction costs

Construction project management




Skills in

Strong written and oral communication and excellent customer service skills

Analyzing and interpreting technical data including building plans, specifications, site plans, reports, and observations

Identify substandard and non-compliant workmanship, installations, and materials

Microsoft Office Suite and Google Suite to create and maintain reports and communications

AutoCad to create drawings and manage drawing files

Typical office equipment including computers, printers, plotters, etc.

Navigating computer networks to accomplish daily activities

Managing and interfacing with consultants in all phases of work




Ability to

Maintain professional and respectful demeanor in all interaction with coworkers, customers and vendors

Assist unit architects and designers in developing drawings and construction documents

Organize, plan, coordinate, and execute daily activities with little oversight to ensure timely completion of duties

Establish priorities and show meticulous attention to detail and accuracy

Analyze operating procedures and financial data

Make adjustments in daily schedule to address unforeseen and emergency issues

Contribute to Continuous Improvement efforts by identifying inefficiencies in current processes or procedures and offering solutions

Read and understand construction plans and specifications

Analyze construction problems and determine optimum solutions

Manage multiple projects at one time

Selective Preference(s):

The ideal candidate for this position will have:

A Bachelor's Degree in Architecture, Architectural Engineering, or Architectural Project Management with 5 years of experience in vertical construction project administration and/or design development OR any equivalent combination of experience, training, and/or education that has provided comparable knowledge, skills, and abilities.

Pre-Employment Requirements:

This position requires possession of a valid Arizona Class D Driver License. Candidates for this position must complete and sign the Driver Form (page 5) of the State of Arizona Application for Employment at the time of interview, which will allow ADOT to obtain the candidate's motor vehicle record (MVR). The most recent 39-month period shown on the MVR will be reviewed in accordance with A.A.C. R2-10-207.11 (H) and (I). The review must show an acceptable driving record prior to any offer of employment being made by ADOT. Employment is contingent upon an acceptable MVR.

Optional employee benefits include short-term disability insurance, deferred compensation plans, and supplemental life insurance

Job Summary

We are looking for an experienced person who has been in large firms but is now ready to get into smaller environment with less politics and people.

As an AZ Registered Architect, you are able to oversee, handle and run the daily operations and functions of our tiny office.

Such functions would include preparing proposals to Client, setting up the budget of project, overseeing and directing staff to create construction documents and gain city approval, while coordinating with engineers, clients and city.

Your role would be to have responsibility over the day-to-day events so that the Owner (who does this now) would be freed up to build and grow other parts of the organization.

Architect Duties and Responsibilities

Have mastery of Commercial T.I. Projects.

Possess experience with Ground Up Commercial Projects including Site Planning and Entitlements.

Philosophy of carrying out a functional and technical mission over that of a design-intense endeavor.

Be familiar with and comfortable working with every-day people and first-timers as Clients.

Take part in and adhere to budget set with Client.

Must have working knowledge of the codes and ordinances in the 12 or so AZ municipalities.

Must be capable of (upon starting with the company) following company-specific process and systems put in place to carry out projects, while over the long term, contributing to improving these tools and processes.

Candidate has knowledge of construction practices and has an appreciation and enthusiasm for working together with our construction company as a design-build process, many times with minimal specification & budget.

Architect is interested in running an office as if it were his/her own firm on behalf of ownership.

Architect Requirements and Qualifications

Bachelor of Architecture minimum.

Training from a program approved by the National Architectural Accrediting Board.

Prior experience as a Project Architect.

Must be Registered Architect in AZ or taking ARE exams.

(AXP must be complete) Fast with AutoCAD. Basic knowledge of Revit.

Negotiable salary depending upon experience.

Great variety in project types within the "Commercial only" sector, means there is no Residential work performed at this company.

We enjoy learning about our client's dreams to open business locations, then get to lead them as an expert through the steps to opening those doors Providing services from land/building selection, through design & engineering, construction and grand opening (all in-house), this office is extremely busy.

It operates by each team member understanding their part, what needs to be done, and then being trusted to execute it.

We are heavy loaded and fast paced, but fun We are eager to help more Clients, bigger Clients and become the best at doing it

Full Job Description

WHO ARE YOU?

Your job is to deliver visually amazing designs that align to our client’s strategy, the customer journey, and to deliver operational success. Our project designs include retail remodels, new build ground-ups, corporate headquarters, clinics, urgent cares and dental offices for clients across the country. Having the ability to illustrate your ideas and appropriately convey your concepts to clients is key.

This individual will assist us in future aspirations within our Design Department focusing on Financial Institutions and Healthcare.

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

7+ years of Design experience working with an Architectural firm
Commercial / retail, office and healthcare experience is preferred
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, needed for effectively communicating and presenting to clients
A creative mind and spirt that elevates those around them in a professional and fun working environment
Proficient in the following software: AutoCAD, Revit, Sketchup, PowerPoint, and basic Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, etc.)
Knowledge of and experience with LEED is an advantage but not required
The ability to travel to our clients located throughout the continental US. (Most trips average 1-3 days)

Stellar positive work ethic, attitude plus ambition are the keys!

WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

What we offer is an amazing culture, opportunity for travel, a competitive salary, profit sharing, generous medical insurance coverage, paid time off, 401k match and the luxury of working in an award-winning environment in a place where you can make a difference.

WHAT WILL YOUR DAY LOOK LIKE?

Creating Conceptual Designs: computer illustrating site plans, building architecture, space plans and conceptual vignettes within a collaborative team structure. Specification of furniture, fixture and equipment selections. Exterior shell building design with material specifications, structural and MPE coordination.

Creating Floor and Ceiling Plans: CAD or REVIT plan backgrounds, sections, elevations, and detailing.

Designing Millwork and Components: design of custom millwork pieces specific to client’s needs. Integration of current technologies into furniture pieces and producing preliminary shop drawings for dimensional and material specifications.

Client Interactions: lead client meetings and presentations of design solutions with a knowledgeable and comfortable experience; supported by a team of interior designers and subject matter experts.

Designing Architecture: design of interior and exterior environments specific to the financial institution, corporate headquarter or healthcare facility. Incorporation of cutting-edge technology into the customer journey.

Communicating with Municipalities: ability to contact the governing authorities, understand the project requirements and perform the project due diligence.

WHO ARE WE?

Ready to be a part of something big? Most everybody wants to be on a winning team and DBSI is an innovative, comprehensive design-build company that dominates the banking, healthcare and corporate headquarter industries. Our market-proven process is revolutionizing how banks, credit unions and healthcare providers serve their communities.

Think about the last time you went to your client’s institution or facility… Underwhelming, right? Our solutions align perfectly with our market needs to ensure our designs provide an exceptional, advisory experience that helps our clients positively impact their consumer’s future. Our entire, ever-evolving solution set and the process is centered around looking for industry problems to solve, then building game-changing solutions to solve them. Seems simple, right?

Well, our strategy is working! DBSI has already been named one of Inc. 5,000 Fastest Growing Companies, named Most Innovative, done more than $1B worth of work, and earned raving fans across the entire United States.

To build upon our success, we are logically investing to do just that, and that investment could be in you. Now is your chance to build with us and join our mission to redefine the banking and healthcare industries!

What does life at DBSI look like?

A typical corporate environment is pretty stiff. Not at DBSI. We like to keep it loose and fun, but still be professional. Imagine working in an environment where the mantra is “create the company you’d want to hire” - this means we are continuously building the right place to work, and the solutions that align to market needs.

This is a culture where team members are encouraged to take charge, and where integrity rules all. We trust and respect everyone to do their jobs to the best of their abilities. Learning new skills, mentoring team members, and exploring personal development are all welcome and encouraged here. DBSI knows with professional growth comes great opportunities. That's why we like to promote from within and give our team members the opportunity to rise with us.

As a team member of DSBI, you will be integral to our company's success.

A Project Architect is responsible for implementing complex architectural projects, including Design, Construction Documents, Permitting, Bidding and Construction Administration. Included is coordination with other disciplines. Supervises and ensures team members are trained.

Requirements:

A Project Architect shall hold an active architectural license and shall have a minimum of 5-10 years' experience in a professional office. This position requires a complete understanding of building construction methods and techniques as well as the major model codes. Final responsibility for the technical quality and success of the project lies with the Project Architect II.


Responsibilities/Skills:

Initiate and direct coordination with engineering disciplines, including guidance and direction on types of systems to be used
Cost estimating.
Perform in depth architectural and engineering coordination quality control checks.
Advanced skills in research, planning, design, CDs, administration/inspections.
Promotes sustainable design.
Seeks and encourages marketing involvement.
Helps shape office vision and mission.
Conducts performance reviews.
Prepare statements of probable cost.
Signing & sealing.
Oversee Production of CDs of multiple projects.
Maintains C&P standards and QC throughout projects.
Resolves design issues/answers questions.
Assists PM in setting scope and budget.
Assists client's interests in public hearings & meetings.
Capable of running a large sized project or series of medium projects.
Assists in bid process.
Assists in providing full CA services.
Assists in proposal preparation.
Mentor, teach and lead.
Preparation and presentation of design drawings.
Analyze client problems/problem solving.
Produce design, CDs, and specifications.
Complete scope within allotted time/budget.
Manage permitting process/response to comments.
Manage bidding procedures.
Minor field assistance with CA.
Research and apply applicable codes/Contact w/AHJs.
Coordinate w/other disciplines, runs kickoff meeting.
Makes presentations to clients/develop design solutions.
Resolves technical issues/answers questions.
Coordinate Peer review and QC of documents.
Perform in-depth QC review of documents.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

Must be able to sit and/or stand for long periods of time, able to handle stressful situations and multi-tasking, able to work under time constraints, long hours may be required. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Overtime (40+ hours) may be required as needed.


WORK ENVIRONMENT:

Must be able to handle stressful situations, multi-tasking, and working within reasonable time constraints to meet production schedules and budgets. Will work in normal office environment and may also be required to work outside of a normal office from time-to-time.

PROJECT MANAGERS at Ideation Design Group are to assist their Studio Director in managing all aspects of a project assigned to their studio. This includes a working collaboration with the foodservice and interior design departments where applicable, managing ALL members of their studio including, Job Captains and CAD Techs.

FOR PROJECT

· Must understand and coordinate the Architectural process with attention of the overall Scope of Work, attention to detail and assisting in creating the Cartoon Set with the Studio Director.

· Assist Studio Director in scheduling and facilitating ALL project kick-off meetings to determine overall project scope including; staff needs, collaboration needs, engineering, project budget, schedule, and deliverables.

· When Studio Director is out of office, the Project Manager shall assist in running the Studio and report back to the Studio Director what transpired in his or her absence.

· Assist with RFP to Engineers for project. Studio Director to approve and engage the project engineers.

· Meet with Staff and on occasion client to better understand and interpret project scope.

· Manage the preparation construction documents which shall include:

Assist in preparing a Cartoon Set of the Complete Set of CD’s
Identifying and understanding any published Tenant Guidelines for project and any Third-Party Tenant Coordination requirements.
Identifying and understanding of ALL codes applicable to the project
Assist with Due Diligence for each project.
Assist Studio Director in assigning Studio Team members tasks for their portion of the CD’s.
Daily review of drawing progress with checklist.
Constant coordination with Foodservice department, Interior Design Department and Consultants to ensure drawings are fully coordinated.
Determine ALL submittal requirements for submittal of final drawings.
Gather all final drawings and put into a 90% final set of CDs’ ready for in-house QA check of documents.
Assist in Final QA review shall be done by Studio Director and Project Manager prior to a third-party review.
Direct staff on submitting final 100% documents to client, client’s distribution, Landlord, Bidders, Building Department, Health Department and any other party required to review drawings for permitting and approval.
Review revised plans with all comments received and response letters to ensure all items are addressed fully.
Provide contracted Construction Administration by answering questions and RFI’s, reviewing shop drawings and submittals that may arise during construction.
Occasional Site visits may be part of CA work based on contract.
Assist with Project Closeout by creating and distributing As-Built documents for archive purposes.

Besides producing a complete set of accurate constructions documents the following responsibilities are also required to be done by the firm’s PROJECT MANAGER;

· Take ownership of your work and your staff’s work

· Must be able to manage multiple projects at any time

· Mentor new and less experienced staff

· Assist in Ideation office standards and processes

· Communicate effectively with project meetings and sketches.

· Keep ALL deadlines and project budgets in mind at all times.

· Assist in training of studio members

· Keep Studio Director informed to when to bill out a project.

· Keep Studio Director informed to any Risk Management issues

· Assist in post mortem of the project with studio members to better the next one.

Who is Multistudio?

Multistudio collaboratively expands the practice of design from cities to buildings to branding. We believe that diversity of thought, people and disciplines helps us spark change. Through our portfolio of projects, neither size nor type dictates their importance.

Their impact does.

Position Description and Responsibilities

We are seeking full-time Project Architects for each of our five office locations. Our San Francisco office is recruiting for in-office positions, as well as hybrid/remote roles for California-based candidates. In this role you’ll be responsible for ensuring the excellence of a project’s design. You’ll have in-depth involvement coordinating the client’s vision with the Studio team to help ensure a successfully executed design.

You’ll participate in providing design concepts and technical documents for projects. You can expect to work with a project team that ensures the projects meet metrics for energy performance, financial performance and design excellence.

Professional degree in architecture, architecture license, and 5-10 years’ related experience
Experience working with high design projects
Strong rendering skills and proficiency with Revit 2020
Strong skills in communication, design, consultant coordination, construction administration, and drawing
Ability to create new ideas both independently and in collaboration

United Integrated Services (UIS) provides electric system integration engineering services. Our services include computer, telecommunication, and control system, as well as traditional electric and air conditioning engineering integration services. UIS also manufactures and markets uninterrupted power supply equipment. Subcontractor of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC)’s 5-nanometer semiconductor fab in North Phoenix, Arizona.

The Construction Design Manager coordinates the design services on all Design/Build projects. Also required is the ability and knowledge to effectively understand the design and construction process, relate and communicate closely with Team members from the Design and Engineering Services, Construction Operations, Government Representatives, Suppliers, Subcontractors, across multiple projects and locations. Requires a thorough understanding of Request for Proposals (RFP) and Scope of Work (SOW). This individual through their activities will assist the team members in resolving project concerns, address design and regulatory issues, develop and nurture current client relationships and expectations, demonstrate the company’s superior ability in providing construction services to clients. This person is the key contact between UIS and is responsible for ensuring that all requirements while maintaining schedule and budget.

Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities

Technical Knowledge: Acquire functional knowledge of government contracts, adhere-enforce regulations and code. Upon RFP receipt be able to quickly review and gain a complete understanding of the SOW.

Safety and Security: Understands necessity to keep certain project-related documents secure and files appropriately. Security is also observed in e-mail traffic (what documents are sent to parties outside the company).

Customer Service: Acts in a professional manner (both verbal and written) at all times as befitting a company representative. E-mails are concise, letters are properly formatted and well-written, submittal data are turned over in compliance with the contract and task order. Telephone conversations are informative to fit the subject matter being discussed and kept brief. Messages from customers and subcontractors to the management team are delivered promptly and accurately. Manage Site Investigations and Existing Building Surveys with Design teams. Prepare site investigation workbooks, conduct teleconference with government representatives, and travel to sites for field investigation of projects leading teams of architects and engineers, conduct interviews with government officials and end users, coordinate with the construction team on feasibility, ensure completeness of investigations, resolve issues and review risks.
Profit Management: At each design stage, work with estimating group or construction team to identify any items that may be a cost issue, or out of scope items. Effectively manage Design Consultants in timely submission of deliverables to avoid any project delays that may impact construction durations. Closely monitor and manage UIS personnel costs during the Construction phases to stay within the pre-established Construction Budget.
Communication: Make sure all documents, e-mail, etc. are filed in a timely manner for future retrieval if necessary. Communication with individuals outside the project team office in the completion of tasks is required. Maintain relationship with construction team during construction to gain experience from field activities. Create a log of any items that were problematic during construction that could have been addressed during pre-construction.
Post Design and Construction: Monitor progress with the site PMs, senior and regional construction mangers; as required, participate in weekly progress meetings, assist with design issues or changes, and coordinate via the DOR.
Facilitate Abilities: Manage the design process - Oversee, review and modify, as required, maintaining costs and scope during the development of Site Investigation Report; Design Development Submissions (includes: design, including interior configuration, narratives, specifications, LEED as required by the project, manufacture data, submittals, calculations, alternatives and risks). Insure recording of conversations and decisions made during the different stages of design. Coordinate and review with construction and subcontractors the designs at each stage adhering to the SOW. Complete drawing and specification reviews and comment on consistency and inclusion of all project goals. Identify any out-of-scope items.
Customer review, delays, and change orders (CO): Manage the Customer review process, coordinate with the Designer of Record (DOR), construction and subcontractors for evaluations & response. Monitor design schedule for time line adherence, and client review periods. As required, address requested change in SOW, initiate correspondence, respond to CO’s (RFP) coordinate with estimating on scope, design and construction impact, and time delays.
Technical Competence: Microsoft Office Products (Word, Excel, Office 365, MS 360, Project), Comprehensive knowledge of construction materials, methods, order of construction and scheduling. Reading and understanding of drawings, schematics, Codes, Regulations and government guidelines.

Basic Qualifications

Education and/or Experience: A degree in Architecture, Engineering, or Management with five years of actual experience in design build and interior/exterior renovations as project manager, general contractor, design manager, senior architect or engineer experienced as design team manager. Knowledge and experience in the construction of healthcare facilities, laboratories, and Government contracting.
Preferred certifications: PMP, AIA, PE, LEED AP. Knowledge of AutoCAD is a plus.

Full Job Description
Are you passionate about technology and interested in joining a community of collaborative colleagues who respectfully and courageously seek to challenge the status quo? If so, read on to learn more about an exciting opportunity with Deloitte's Information Technology Services (ITS). We are curious and life-long learners focused on technology and innovation.

Work You'll Do:

In your role, you will be responsible for envisioning and developing new digital products. You will execute day-to-day product development activities across design, development, stakeholder communication, technology vendor management and delivery.

Responsibilities:

Lead clients, complex projects, drive business requirement gathering, manage scope and client expectations
Designs long-term, reliable, and end-to-end technical architectures. Develop functional architecture design and contribute to product vision
Transforms detailed requirements into a complete, detailed systems design document
Supports creation of interface specifications and call flows for the various components in the design
Provide inputs to create Agile user stories based on marketing business requirements
Provide technical support for analysis of business requirements and applicability to the current or planned Platform/Enabler/API Platform capabilities
Participate in E2E functionality assessment during Validation Testing phases (SIT, UAT)
Experience with technical programming; capable of leading teams designing, programming and implementing various technical solutions
Serve as a technical liaison between the business, project team and developers/testers
Work with IT infrastructure teams to deploy and maintain applications

The Team

Information Technology Services (ITS) helps power Deloitte's success. ITS drives Deloitte, which serves many of the world's largest, most respected organizations. We develop and deploy cutting-edge internal and go-to-market solutions that help Deloitte operate effectively and lead in the market. Our reputation is built on a tradition of delivering with excellence.

The ~2,500 professionals in ITS deliver services including:

Security, risk & compliance
Technology support
Infrastructure
Applications
Relationship management
Strategy
Deployment
PMO
Financials
Communications

Deloitte Application Studios (DAS)

Deloitte Application Studios (DAS) is the internal software and applications development team responsible for delivering leading-edge technologies to Deloitte professionals. Their broad portfolio includes web and mobile productivity tools that empower our people to log expenses, enter timesheets, book travel and more, anywhere, anytime. DAS enables our client service professionals through a comprehensive suite of applications across the business lines. In addition to application delivery, DAS offers full-scale design services, a robust mobile portfolio, cutting-edge analytics, and innovative custom development.

Qualifications:

Required

Minimum of 6+ years of industry related experience
Minimum of 3+ years in an architect capacity
Minimum of 1+ years of experience in leading architecture activities like designing, roadmap, & proof-of-concepts.
Prior experience in native application architecture and deployment in cloud environments - Azure, AWS, GCP etc.
A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, or related discipline. While an advanced degree is preferred, the value is placed on the extent of the relevant experience and accomplishments

Preferred

Exposure to Cloud Cognitive Services, AI platforms, Edge Computing
TOGAF or SEI - Software Architecture Certification etc.,
Exposure to BI Tools - like Tableau, PowerBI, Qliksense and DI Tools like Informatica etc.,
Experience working with SAFe or Agile development processes.
Prior experience in e- commerce, EDI, B2B architectures
Ability to lead multiple customers, complex projects, and multiple initiatives
Prior experience in web-based mobile technologies like Microsoft .Net, ASP.NET Web API and complementary business layer and front-end technologies like AngularJs, ReactJs, NodeJS, Xamarin etc.,
Prior experience with Microsoft SQL Server, MongoDB, Cosmos DB, Oracle etc.,
Limited Immigration Sponsorship may be available
Ability to travel 10%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve

The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the range is $104,575-$214,740.

You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

Deloitte Application Studios (DAS)

Deloitte Application Studios (DAS) is the internal software and applications development team responsible for delivering leading-edge technologies to Deloitte professionals. Their broad portfolio includes web and mobile productivity tools that empower our people to log expenses, enter timesheets, book travel and more, anywhere, anytime. DAS enables our client service professionals through a comprehensive suite of applications across the business lines. In addition to application delivery, DAS offers full-scale design services, a robust mobile portfolio, cutting-edge analytics, and innovative custom development.

Qualifications:

A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, or related discipline. While an advanced degree is preferred, the value is placed on the extent of the relevant experience and accomplishments
